remarks: If the metric ` D ` is "strongly finer" than ` C ` (meaning that there is a positive real constant ` R ` such that ` C ( x , y ) <_ R x. D ( x , y ) ` ), all the ` D ` -Cauchy sequences are also ` C ` -Cauchy.  (Using this theorem twice in each direction states that if two metrics are strongly equivalent, then they have the same Cauchy sequences.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2015.)
statement:
equivcau.1 $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( Met ` X ) ) $.
equivcau.2 $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( Met ` X ) ) $.
equivcau.3 $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
equivcau.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> ( x C y ) <_ ( R x. ( x D y ) ) ) $.
equivcau $p |- ( ph -> ( Cau ` D ) C_ ( Cau ` C ) ) $.
$d C x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d ph x y $.
